org.fluidity.foundation.spi

Interface PropertyProvider


  • public interface PropertyProvider
    Maps property keys to property values. You provide an implementation that suits your configuration logic. As long as the implementation is annotated as @Component, Fluid Tools will find and use it.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  PropertyProvider.Query<T>
      Properties reader passed to properties(PropertyProvider.Query).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default <T> T properties(PropertyProvider.Query<T> query)
      Runs the given command to read properties and if supported, guarantees that no property update takes place while the command executes.
      Object property(String key)
      Returns the configured value for the given property or null if no property was configured for the given key.

    • Method Detail

      • property

        Object property(String key)
        Returns the configured value for the given property or null if no property was configured for the given key. Default values are assigned to missing property values at higher levels.
        Parameters:
        key - the property name, or key.
        Returns:
        the configured value for the given property or null if no property was configured for the given key.

      • properties

        default <T> T properties(PropertyProvider.Query<T> query)
                  throws Exception
        Runs the given command to read properties and if supported, guarantees that no property update takes place while the command executes. If properties are read from a database, this method must open an isolated transaction before running the given command and then close the transaction afterwards. Other implementation may use locking to prevent changes to the properties while this method executes.

        The default implementation assumes a static set of properties or an atomic snapshot thereof.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the return type of the given query.
        Parameters:
        query - the command that reads properties and expects no changes in the property values while doing so.
        Returns:
        whatever the query returns.
        Throws:
        Exception - when some error occurs.
